verses.roman:
śaureḥ sapta-daśāhaṁ vai
saṁyugāni parājitaḥ
trayo-viṁśatibhiḥ sainyair
jigye ekam ahaṁ param

synonyms: śaureḥ—with Kṛṣṇa; sapta-daśa—seventeen; aham—I; vai—indeed; saṁyugāni—battles; parājitaḥ—lost; trayaḥ-viṁśatibhiḥ—twenty-three; sainyaiḥ—with armies; jigye—won; ekam—one; aham—I; param—only.
translation: In battle with Kṛṣṇa I and my twenty-three armies lost seventeen times; only once did I defeat Him.

purport.content: Jarāsandha offers his own life as an example of the inevitable happiness and distress of this material world.
